intro: Psiadia, commonly known as the blueweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. The plants typically have small, blue or purple flowers arranged in composite heads, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Psiadia species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Their foliage is usually narrow and aromatic, with some species possessing medicinal properties.
